title: Twisted Twig 2011 Sommelier Quality Fifty-Fifty Red (El Dorado County)
description: Big and tannic, but tempting and tasty at the same time, this wine tastes ripe, full bodied and fruity, wrapping a blanket of fine tannins around the richness to keep it from being too sweet or overripe. It's half Merlot and half Petite Sirah.

title: Skyfall 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of spice, dried herbs and plum lead to plump blue-fruit flavors with a touch of sugar stitching them together. This doesn't bring a lot of complexity but still has appeal.

title: Snoqualmie 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of herbs and jammy fruit are light while the palate offers plush-feeling cocoa and berry flavors. This offers a lot of enjoyment for the price.

title: Snoqualmie 2013 Whistle Stop Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Cabernet (70%) and Merlot, it offers aromas of dried herbs and rasinated dark fruit along with a kiss of vanilla. The fruit flavors are plump in feel with a sweet finish.

title: Rutherford Hill 2012 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Structured and grippy, this small-production wine offers the appellation's dusty tannins around coconut, vanilla, plum and dark cherry. Medium in body and length, it shows the ripeness and instant likability of the vintage.

title: Sequoia Grove 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The winery's larger-production blend of several vineyard sources, given 20 months in American oak, this wine opens in pungent earth, soy and mushroom, reminiscent of a beef bouillon or beef stew. Big tannins surround the fruit, accented in black licorice and black coffee before finishing lean.

title: Seraphim 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Valley)
description: Dry, fresh aromas of cherry and red plum create a direct bouquet. Crisp, almost biting acidity makes for a long-lasting, hard-driving juicy mouthfeel with flavors of briny, snappy plum and red currant.

title: Silver Thread 2014 STV Estate Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: Dusty mineral tones accent cutting, crisp peach, apricot and lime notes in this dry-style Riesling. The palate is zesty and spry, finishing on a thirst quenching streak of white grapefruit.

title: Ventosa 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)
description: Whiffs of sweet baking spice, cedar and tobacco entice from nose to finish on this unabashedly fruity and oaky, but enjoyable Cab. Juicy vanilla-cherry cola notes permeate the rich palate, cut by a razor's edge of acidity on the finish.

title: Santa Luz 2013 Gran Reserva Corte Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Jammy, herbal black-fruit aromas open things in straightforward Carmenère fashion. This feels full and fairly fresh, with integrated acidity keeping the palate on course. Herbal berry flavors show chocolaty oak in front of a spicy finish.

title: Trump 2014 Estate Bottled Viognier (Monticello)
description: The nose screams Viognier, with aromas of Juicy Fruit gum, white flowers and powdered candy necklace. A peaches-and-cream palate feels lush and viscous, yet the acid manages to keep things lively through the fuzzy-textured finish.

title: Brennan 2012 Tempranillo (Texas)
description: Sweet mesquite meets dark berries and anise on the nose of this Texan Tempranillo. The medium-bodied palate is juicy with red fruit, yet crisp in acidity and supported by ample tannins. Toasted coconut and vanilla adds depth to the finish.

title: Brennan 2013 Tempranillo (Texas)
description: Condensed dark cherry and plum meet some savory elements on the nose. Silky on entry, with prickling acidity, the medium-bodied palate boasts juicy black-fruit flavors and red-currant acidity. There's enough tannic structure and fruit here to pair alongside hearty grilled fare.

title: Château Sainte-Marguerite 2013 Cuvée Symphonie Red (Côtes de Provence La Londe)
description: With its tall, elegant bottle, this wine is designed to be an event. Perhaps too much so, for the wine itself is tough, extracted and needs a long time to soften. Wood flavors are very evident at this stage, masking the potential of the black currant fruits. Wait at least until 2018 before drinking.

title: Claar 2011 Estate Grown and Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine opens with aromas of vanilla and baking spices that are followed by broad, silky-feeling fruit and barrel flavors, finishing on a somewhat bitter note. The oak holds a prominent role but still plays its part well.

title: Clos du Bois 2013 Calcaire Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Tahitian vanilla and white flowers mark the opening bouquet of this wine, followed by rich, full-bodied flavors of apple tart, pear and caramelized minerality. A tart, ripe finish caps things off.

title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2014 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: From an estate that dates back to the 13th century, this rich wine is fully formed, ripe in red currant and crushed strawberry flavors. The balance between the delicious fruit and the acidity is showing well. Drink now.

title: Concha y Toro 2012 Casillero del Diablo Manchester United Legendary Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Cherry and berry aromas are rubbery and oaky, and overall this creamy Cabernet is perfectly enjoyable. On the palate, tomato-driven acidity creates pulse, while flavors of plum and raspberry finish fresh.
designation: Casillero del Diablo Manchester United Legendary Collection

title: Cooper-Garrod 2009 Test Pilot Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Very showy aromas of mocha, blackberry, blueberry, grape soda and lilac pop on the nose of this one-third-each blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. The palate is bright and juicy with black currants and plum soda, proving quite easy to swallow.

title: Channing Daughters 2013 Sylanus Vineyard Tocai Friulano (Long Island)
description: Spice, smoke and dusty minerals accent shades of almond and hazelnut in this uniquely savory, dry wine. It's deeply textural, contrasting a slick, rolling richness on the palate against touches of tannin. It finishes with a lingering tang of salt.

title: 13 Celsius 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied wine hits all the requisite Sauvignon Blanc marks. Herbal? Check. Passion fruit? Check. Crisp, mouthwatering finish? Check. It's a reasonably good value, especially if you can find it discounted.

title: 14 Hands 2014 The Reserve Rosé of Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Electric-pink in color, that offers aromas of cranberries and watermelon that lead to dry fruit flavors with a tart finish. It doesn't entirely stand up on its own but should fit in nicely at the dinner table.

title: Ambasciata del  Buon Vino 2010  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: This opens with aromas of scorched earth, cured meat, underbrush and ripe blackberry. The evolved palate offers coffee, mocha, vanilla, raisin and blackberry extract alongside close-grained tannins. Enjoy sooner rather than later.

title: Dopff Au Moulin 2014 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: While ample flavors of apricot and rose are made even richer by residual sweetness, the components are abundant but slightly out of focus. Opulent and round, this might find its match in a mature wedge of oozing Munster cheese.

title: Emile Beyer 2014 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: Softly ripe notes of pear mingle with earthier elements on nose and palate of this dryish Riesling. The spine of acidity provides structure and fills the palate with lemony, bright freshness that lingers pleasantly.

title: EOS 2012 Algunas Dias Single Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Red fruits, barrel smoke and chipped slate make for an intriguing although not entirely integrated nose on this single-vineyard bottling. The palate shows red berries, wet clay and hints of anise.

title: EOS 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Plums, purple flowers and graphite characterize the nose on this wine from the producer that's now owned by the Foley family of wines. Spicy cherries and blackberries show on the palate long with pencil lead and hints of dried oregano.

title: Louis Max 2013  Côtes de Nuits Villages
description: From vineyards outside the main village appellations of the Côte de Nuits, this is a firm, almost austere wine. It has a dry extract character that is suppressing the red plum and berry fruit flavors. Give it time, although it is probably always going to be dry.

title: Mezzacorona 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: Aromas of cassis, underbrush and toast lead the nose on this simple but well-made red. The easy-drinking palate delivers black currant, raspberry, coffee and a toasted note alongside polished tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.

title: Millbrook 2013 Pinot Noir (New York)
description: There's a savory, slightly demure quality to this elegant Pinot Noir. The palate is not deeply concentrated, but crisp black cherry and plum flavors are shaded by tones of granite and dried herbs. Persistent, fine-grained tannins mark a moderate finish.
